definition: to set an example (idiom); to serve as a model
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Teachers are landmarks, set an example and a direction.
sentences.chinese: 教師是路標，以身作則，指引方向。

sentences.english: Instead, you can set an example by following these common airplane courtesies .
sentences.chinese: 相反地，你可以以身作則，遵守下列一般搭機禮儀。

sentences.english: The key to implementing these decisions will be the personal example set by the senior cadres.
sentences.chinese: 貫徹執行的關鍵在於高級幹部要以身作則。

sentences.english: The best way to educate others is, as I said above, by your good example.
sentences.chinese: 正如我以上所說，教育別人最好的方法就是以身作則。

sentences.english: Show a united front. Teen-agers sometimes favor one parent over the other.
sentences.chinese: 團結一致，以身作則青少年有時會偏愛父親或母親。

sentences.english: In order to do all these, a teacher must set an example of him- or herself.
sentences.chinese: 要做到所有這一切，教師必須以身作則。

sentences.english: Educate. The best way to educate others is, as I said above, by your good example.
sentences.chinese: 正如我以上所說，教育別人最好的方法就是以身作則。

sentences.english: You taught by example and for that I am grateful.
sentences.chinese: 你以身作則，身教重於言教，對此我非常感激。

sentences.english: Modeling or role-playing is one of the best means of teaching a child.
sentences.chinese: 以身作則是最好的教育孩子方法之一。

sentences.english: We, by example, don't live like you do.
sentences.chinese: 我們，以身作則，不會像你們一樣生活。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to do one's duty/to do one's bit conscientiously
having both integrity and talent (idiom)
to keep in mind/to remember
example/model/CL:個|个[ge4]
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
kind and charitable
unswerving from start to finish (idiom)
to work hard without complaint (idiom)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
people-oriented
to cultivate/to raise/to form (a habit)/to acquire
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
